column4: I'm using dual monitor with separate X screens. When I want to launch a program from terminal, how do i let it know which screen to open in? Write now everything's going to the 2nd monitor
do you have displays :0.0 and :0.1?
i dont know
where do I check that
xdpyinfo would tell you which screens you have.  The screen number comes after the 0.
you should be able to do something like:  xterm -display :0.0   to make it be on a certain screen.  If the program doesn't support that you can use: env DISPLAY=:0.0 someprogram &
Okay it's 0 and 1, and the default screen is set to 0
Sorry I mean default is 1
how do I make the default screen 0
I'm not certain, but perhaps via your /etc/X11/xorg.conf  mine is by default screen 0
Mine was normal before, but after I restarted gdm, somehow everything's now going to the 2nd screen
do you have any mention of your "Default Screen" in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf ServerLayout?
yes it's there
it's there in section "Screen"
http://www.nomorepasting.com/getpaste.php?pasteid=9300 This is what my xorg.conf says
I never added anything in there myself. I let nvidia-settings set it up
It was working fine till now.. I don't know how it set a default screen without asking me
I wonder if it could be the xinerama settings. I don't personally use xinerama, with my multiple displays
I don't have xinerama enabled
did you use this: #Removed Option "Xinerama" "1"  ?
I wish I had further advice other than hints.  You mentioned that you restarted GDM.  Perhaps it has something to do with changing the default screen.
